text: Molecular cloning and functional characterization of murine cDNA encoding transcription factor <extra_id_0> NFATc <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

Transcription factors of the NFAT ( nuclear factor of activated T cells ) family play important roles in immune and inflammatory responses by regulating the expression of genes encoding cytokines and immunoregulatory proteins .

Here we describe cloning and characterization of full-length cDNA encoding <extra_id_0> murine (m) NFATc <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> which predicts that the protein has all the conserved structural motifs of NFAT family members , including the rel homology domain , the NFAT homology domain and the nuclear translocation signals .

text: Northern blot analysis showed that the cDNA probe hybridized with a 4.5 kb transcript which is highly inducible in murine T cells .
By Northern and in situ hybridization , <extra_id_0> mNFATc <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transcript was detected from the early stage of development .

In the mouse embryo , <extra_id_0> mNFATc <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transcript was strongly expressed in thymus , lung and submandibular gland and weakly in skeletal muscle and heart suggesting that <extra_id_0> mNFATc <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> may have a role both in embryogenesis and in mature T cells .
